chapterTitle: Some Lessons From Capital Market History

columns.text: In this problem, we need to solve for the dividend yield and the capital gains yield.

Using this formula, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Dividend yield}&=\dfrac{\$1.45}{\$65}\\
&=0.0223\\
&=2.23\%
\end{aligned}$$

The dividend yield for this stock is $0.0223$ or $2.23\%$

Using this formula, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Capital gains yield}&=\dfrac{\$71-\$65}{\$65}\\
&=0.0923\\
&=9.23\%
\end{aligned}$$

The capital gains yield for this share is $9.23\%$

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
